SEARCH
Package mvc

Class MazeData

java.lang.Object
mvc.MazeData
public class MazeData extends Object
This model class represents a maze layout. Each cell is represented by a MazeItem. The maze and inventory are updated in real time by the GameplayScreen.
Since:
March 11, 2024
Version:
1.0
Author:
Chun Ho Chan (Edward)

  • Constructor Details

    • MazeData

      public MazeData(int stageID, MazeTypeEnum[][] mazeItemGrid, int robotRow, int robotColumn)
      Construct a maze data object.
      Parameters:
      stageID - Stage ID
      mazeItemGrid - 2D grid of maze items
      robotRow - Row number of robot's current position
      robotColumn - Column number of robot's current position

  • Method Details

    • importData

      public static MazeData importData(String filename)
      Decode the encoded data stored in a stage data file.
      Parameters:
      filename - Filename of the stage data (prefix + infix + username + suffix)
      Returns:
      MazeData, or null if the file does not exist. Format: (without spaces)
      "row1"
      "row2"
      "..."
      "Objectives"
      "Hints"
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        for details.

    • moveRobot

      public boolean moveRobot(boolean forward)
      Move the robot forward/ back.
      Parameters:
      forward - True if forward, false if back
      Returns:
      True if moved, false otherwise (blocked by wall or dead)

    • rotateRobot

      public boolean rotateRobot(boolean counterClockwise)
      Rotate the robot counter-clockwise/ clockwise.
      Parameters:
      counterClockwise - True if counter-clockwise, false if clockwise
      Returns:
      True if rotated, false otherwise (dead)

    • toFilename

      public static String toFilename(int stageID)
      Convert username to the filename of this maze's data file.
      Parameters:
      stageID - Stage ID
      Returns:
      Filename of that stage data (prefix + infix + stageID + suffix)

    • isIndexOutOfBound

      public static boolean isIndexOutOfBound(int row, int column)
      Help to check if the indices are out-of-bound, i.e. 0 invalid input: '<'= row invalid input: '<' MAX_ROWS and 0 invalid input: '<'= column invalid input: '<' MAX_COLUMNS.
      Parameters:
      row - Row number
      column - Column number
      Returns:
      True if index is out-of-bound, false otherwise
